articles.headline: Kerry Quietly Makes Priority of Climate Pact
articles.snippet: While public attention has been fixed on the Middle East, Secretary of State John Kerry has started a push to create an agencywide focus on global warming.
articles.abstract: While public attention has been fixed on the Middle East, Secretary of State John Kerry has started a push to create an agencywide focus on global warming.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As a young naval officer in Vietnam, John Kerry commanded a Swift boat up the dangerous rivers of the Mekong Delta. But when he returned there last month as secretary of state for the first time since 1969, he spoke not of past firefights but of climate change.

articles.headline: Qaeda-Aligned Militants Threaten Key Iraqi Cities
articles.snippet: Radical Sunni militants freed prisoners, set fire to police stations and seized mosques in Falluja and Ramadi, two of Iraq’s most important cities.
articles.abstract: Radical Sunni militants freed prisoners, set fire to police stations and seized mosques in Falluja and Ramadi, two of Iraq’s most important cities.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD — Radical Sunni militants aligned with Al Qaeda threatened Thursday to seize control of Falluja and Ramadi, two of the most important cities in Iraq, setting fire to police stations, freeing prisoners from jail and occupying mosques, as the government rushed troop reinforcements to the areas.
articles.byline: By Yasir Ghazi and Tim Arango

articles.headline: Allowed to Join the Bar, but Not to Take a Job
articles.snippet: A 36-year-old brought to the country from Mexico as a child can be admitted to the state bar, the California Supreme Court said. But, under federal law, no law firm can legally hire him.
articles.abstract: A 36-year-old brought to the country from Mexico as a child can be admitted to the state bar, the California Supreme Court said. But, under federal law, no law firm can legally hire him.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — As a teenager in Northern California, Sergio Garcia worked in the almond fields and in a grocery store, earning his way through college and then law school. He passed the California bar exam on his first try, something just half of all candidates do.

articles.headline: Ebullience Over 2013 I.P.O. Market Spills Into New Year
articles.snippet: The business of taking companies public soared last year, jumping 40 percent over 2012, and enthusiasm for 2014 remains strong.
articles.abstract: The business of taking companies public soared last year, jumping 40 percent over 2012, and enthusiasm for 2014 remains strong.
articles.lead_paragraph: The next 12 months may not prove as rich for initial public offerings as the last year. But to Wall Street bankers, 2014 still promises an abundance of opportunity.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: FireEye Computer Security Firm Acquires Mandiant
articles.snippet: The deal, melding detection of hacking with sophisticated response to the threat, is worth more than $1 billion.
articles.abstract: The deal, melding detection of hacking with sophisticated response to the threat, is worth more than $1 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In a deal that may have broad repercussions for companies and governments fending off sophisticated hackers and state-sponsored digital attacks, FireEye, a provider of security software, has acquired Mandiant, a company known for emergency responses to computer network breaches.
articles.byline: By Nicole Perlroth and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: A Tablet for Children That Comes With Its Own Penguins
articles.snippet: The DreamTab, produced by Fuhu and DreamWorks Animation, will regularly update with custom content from the animation studio.
articles.abstract: The DreamTab, produced by Fuhu and DreamWorks Animation, will regularly update with custom content from the animation studio.
articles.lead_paragraph: GLENDALE, Calif. — DreamWorks Animation first captivated children in movie theaters. Then it branched into TV, piping cartoons based on hits like “Madagascar” and “How to Train Your Dragon” into homes through outlets like Nickelodeon and Netflix.

articles.headline: Small-Scale Gold Mining Pollutes Indonesian Lands
articles.snippet: Indonesian villagers use mercury to process the ore from small-scale mines, work that carries risks to themselves and the environment.
articles.abstract: Indonesian villagers use mercury to process the ore from small-scale mines, work that carries risks to themselves and the environment.
articles.lead_paragraph: CISITU, Indonesia — In the remote mountains of West Java, workers like 15-year-old David Mario Chandra are an integral part of Indonesia’s gold industry.

articles.headline: Regulator of Wall Street Loses Its Hard-Charging Chairman
articles.snippet: Gary Gensler became known during his tenure at the Commodity Futures Trading Commission for his long work hours and aggressive oversight of the derivatives industry.
articles.abstract: Gary Gensler became known during his tenure at the Commodity Futures Trading Commission for his long work hours and aggressive oversight of the derivatives industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gary Gensler squeezed into a Washington auditorium last month, mingling with the 300 guests at his farewell party and basking in the attention as a who’s who of finance recounted his campaign to rein in Wall Street risk-taking.

articles.headline: Paris Embraces ‘Einstein’ Again
articles.snippet: The opera “Einstein on the Beach,” directed by Robert Wilson, with music by Philip Glass, arrives in Paris.
articles.abstract: The opera “Einstein on the Beach,” directed by Robert Wilson, with music by Philip Glass, arrives in Paris.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — “Einstein on the Beach,” the avant-garde opera composed by Philip Glass and directed by Robert Wilson, is nearing the end of a two-year revival tour with its arrival here. And the city has rolled out the red carpet for Mr. Wilson.
